name: ssbr
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wss(c0, c1), wi(wbr(c2, c0, c3), wbr(c2, c1, c3)))

stmt.origin: ssbrd(c2, c0, c3, c1, wss(c0, c1))
stmt.pretty: ssbrd(c2, c0, c3, c1, c0 ⊆ c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wss(c0, c1), wi(wbr(c2, c0, c3), wbr(c2, c1, c3)))
-| wi(wss(c0, c1), wss(c0, c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wss(c0, c1), wi(wbr(c2, c0, c3), wbr(c2, c1, c3)))
-| wi(wss(c0, c1), wss(c0, c1))
|- wi(wss(c0, c1), wi(wbr(c2, c0, c3), wbr(c2, c1, c3)))

comment: Implication from a subclass relationship of binary relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 11-Nov-2019.)
